snippet: A plantation originally built as a monument to George Washington overlooking the nation’s capital, a site that later was home to Robert E. Lee and 63 slaves, will be restored to its historical appearance.
abstract: David Rubenstein, billionaire history enthusiast and co-founder of The Carlyle Group, is giving National Park Foundation $12.3 million gift to restore Arlington, Va, plantation originally built as monument to George Washington overlooking nation’s capital; says site crowns sacred land of Arlington National Cemetery.
lead_paragraph: A plantation originally built as a monument to George Washington overlooking the nation’s capital, a site that later was home to Robert E. Lee and 63 slaves, will be restored to its historical appearance.
